Description.Title: SiriusQuality Soil Temperature
Description.ExtendedDescription: Component that computes daily minimum and maximum soil surface temperatures from air temperatures, soil heat flux and a latent heat parameter, updates a deep-layer soil temperature via an exponential smoothing, and optionally derives hourly soil temperatures using the Parton & Logan (1981) diurnal curve. Key parameters: lambda_ (latent heat of vaporization), and hourly-shape parameters a, b, c. Inputs include min/max/mean air temperature, mean annual air temperature, day length, and soil heat flux; outputs include min/max soil temperature, hourly soil temperature profile, and deep-layer temperature.
Description.ShortDescription: Daily min/max and hourly soil temperature calculator with deep-layer update (Parton & Logan approach).

Input.name: lambda_
Input.description: Latent heat of water vaporization at 20°C

Function.name: SoilMinimumTemperature
Function.description: Computes soil minimum temperature as the minimum of SoilTempA and SoilTempB.

Function.name: SoilMaximumTemperature
Function.description: Computes soil maximum temperature as the maximum of SoilTempA and SoilTempB.

Function.name: SoilTempA
Function.description: Auxiliary soil temperature based on weather, soil heat flux, and latent heat.

Function.name: SoilTempB
Function.description: Auxiliary soil temperature as average of minimum air temperature and deep soil temperature.

Function.name: UpdateTemperature
Function.description: Updates deep soil layer temperature from min and max soil temperatures.
